      • texture

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        The texture that will be filtered

      • subPixelAliasingRemoval

        public float subPixelAliasingRemoval()

        The amount of subpixel aliasing removal.

        The range of useful values is [0.0, 1.0], where 0.0 turns off filtering and 1.0 gives almost excessive filtering.

        Specified by:
        subPixelAliasingRemoval in interface R2ShaderFilterFXAAParametersType
        Returns:
        The subpixel aliasing removal amount

      • edgeThreshold

        public float edgeThreshold()

        The minimum amount of local contrast required to apply the algorithm.

        The range of useful values is [0.063, 0.333], where 0.333 is fastest but lowest quality, and 0.063 is overkill quality and is relatively slow.

        Specified by:
        edgeThreshold in interface R2ShaderFilterFXAAParametersType
        Returns:
        The edge threshold

      • edgeThresholdMinimum

        public float edgeThresholdMinimum()

        The minimum edge brightness for which to enable filtering.

        The range of useful values is [0.0312, 0.0833], where 0.0312 is slowest, and 0.0833 is fastest.

        This value is somewhat scene-specific, but the default (and highest) value appears to work well. The documentation for the FXAA algorithm suggests looking at mostly-green rendered content (the algorithm depends on luma information taken from the green channel of the filtered image), setting this value at 0.0, and then increasing it until aliasing artifacts appear.

        Specified by:
        edgeThresholdMinimum in interface R2ShaderFilterFXAAParametersType
        Returns:
        The edge threshold minimum
